alert.note: Alert for Bitterroot, Sapphire Mountains; Flathead, Mission Valleys; Lower Clark Fork Region; Missoula, Bitterroot Valleys; Potomac, Seeley Lake Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 5:40PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Mineral, southwestern Missoula, south central Lake, southeastern Sanders, northwestern Granite and north central Ravalli Counties through 615 PM MDT... At 540 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Wye to 7 miles northeast of Stevensville. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Missoula, Ravalli, Lolo, Wye, Evaro, Bonner-West Riverside, Arlee, East Missoula, Frenchtown, Florence, Ninemile, Huson, Quigley, Clinton, and Turah. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between mile markers 79 and 128. Highway 93 N between mile markers 0 and 26, and between mile markers 29 and 30. Highway 93 S between mile markers 73 and 94. Highway 200 E between mile markers 0 and 5. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for northwestern and west central Montana.

area.areaDesc: Bitterroot, Sapphire Mountains; Flathead, Mission Valleys; Lower Clark Fork Region; Missoula, Bitterroot Valleys; Potomac, Seeley Lake Region
